meanings.definition: To measure or determine the capacity or contents of something again.
meanings.sent1: She regauges the water level in the tank to make sure it's accurate.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic regauges the tire pressure before every long trip.
meanings.sent3: The scientist regauges the beaker, hoping for a different result this time.
meanings.sent4: After the storm, the meteorologist regauges the wind speed to assess the damage.
meanings.sent5: He regauges the recipe ingredients to ensure a perfect cake every time.

meanings.definition: To adjust or calibrate a measuring instrument again.
meanings.sent1: The technician regauges the scale to ensure accurate readings.
meanings.sent2: Before the experiment, the researcher regauges the microscope for precision.
meanings.sent3: The chef regauges the oven temperature for the third time to avoid burning the dish.
meanings.sent4: The musician regauges the guitar strings before the performance for optimal sound.
meanings.sent5: She regauges the compass before setting out on the hike to avoid getting lost.
